A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Positives: Incredible cast. Mark Hamill on screen was great. The conflict portrayed in Kylo Ren done very well. Some good moments. Negatives: All the missed opportunities and pointless subplots. Felt like it was made by someone more focused on their sole vision as a director instead of someone passionate about maintaining the integrity of this piece of cinema history. Overall: I left the theater initially wanting to like the film... and almost forcing myself to like it. However\, the more I dwelled on it\, I realized that the negatives outweighed the positives when it came to this film. There are so many great characters and so much potential to play with - but instead.... just missed opportunity after missed opportunity. Update: I’ve had a couple weeks to digest this film... Disney has murdered Star Wars. This is THE absolute worst Star Wars film ever made. The Last Jedi is a disgrace. Rian Johnson... wow. If I could give it 0 out of 5 stars... I would.
